net.java.jddac.jmdi.util
Interface QuerySettingsInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
JddacClient
public interface QuerySettingsInterface

Provide an interface for querying settings from the underlying platform. The QuerySettingsInterface class is used to provide a very minimal configuration interface for jddac startup needs. It can be anything from a console application to a Phone GUI or swing interface. By keeping the interface minimal, platform independance is maintained. The querySettings(ArgArray, ArgArray) method does the actual work while the showStatus(String, String) method is useful for providing feedback for operations that take a long time.

Method Detail

querySettings

ArgArray querySettings(ArgArray queryConfig,
                       ArgArray settings)
Query for input settings. The settings ArgArray specifies a list of name/value pairs which reflect the current value of the settings. Upon completion it also contains any new settings which are also returned from the function. The queryConfig ArgArray specifies hints as to how to prompt for input as well as desired ordering while the queryConfig argument specifies hints as to ordering and input formats.

Parameters:
queryConfig - - An ArgArray contains the following fields:
  • _keyorder - A string array of names found in settings.
  • _fieldtypes - An int array of field type hints such as TEXT or NUMBER.
settings - - An ArgArray keyed by field names with elements representing the values.
Returns:
new settings returned from function.

showStatus

void showStatus(java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String message)
Show a status message to the user.

Parameters:
title - - The title of the message.
message - - The actual message.
